# viewDidUnhide()

**Instance Method**

Invoked when the view is unhidden, either directly, or in response to an ancestor being unhidden

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func viewDidUnhide()
```

## Discussion

The view receives this message when its `isHiddenOrHasHiddenAncestor` state goes from [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true] to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/false].  This can happen when the view or an ancestor is marked as not hidden, or when the view or an ancestor is removed from its containing view hierarchy.

## Showing and Hiding the View

- **isHidden**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is hidden.
- **isHiddenOrHasHiddenAncestor**: A Boolean value indicating whether the view is hidden from sight because it, or one of its ancestors, is marked as hidden.
- **viewDidHide()**: Invoked when the view is hidden, either directly, or in response to an ancestor being hidden.
